Stem: Pale grey or whitish when mature, with small spines.
Leaves: Leaf-like cladodes 12-25 mm long, needle-like, hairless, usually curved and in a cluster of 20-30 along stem. Almost pom-pom like in appearance.
Flowers: White to cream in dense clusters on short stalks.
FruitSeeds: Round berries 6-10 mm across, green maturing to purple or pinkish red.
Habitat: Forests, riparian areas, woodlands, roadsides, waste areas, coastal scrub.
DistinguishingFeatures: Differentiated from other Asparagus ferns (*Asparagus* species) by the combination of small needle-like leaves, shrubby habit, and purplish ripe berries.
